breakfast.name: Oatmeal with Berries
breakfast.description: A warm bowl of rolled oats topped with mixed berries and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
preparation: Bring water or milk to a boil in a small saucepan.
Stir in oats and reduce heat to low.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until oats are tender.
Pour into a bowl and top with mixed berries and chia seeds.

midMorningSnack.name: Greek Yogurt
midMorningSnack.description: A serving of plain Greek yogurt with a drizzle of honey.
preparation: Spoon the Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Drizzle with honey if desired and serve.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken Salad
lunch.description: Grilled chicken breast over a bed of mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, and a light vinaigrette.
preparation: Season and grill the chicken breast until cooked through, then slice.
Combine mixed greens, cucumber, and tomato in a large bowl.
Top with the sliced grilled chicken and drizzle with vinaigrette.

afternoonSnack.name: Apple with Peanut Butter
afternoonSnack.description: A crisp apple with two tablespoons of natural peanut butter.
preparation: Slice the apple.
Serve with peanut butter for dipping.

dinner.name: Baked Salmon with Quinoa
dinner.description: Baked salmon fillet served with a side of quinoa and steamed asparagus.
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Toss asparagus with olive oil and season.
Place salmon and asparagus on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Serve with quinoa and a squeeze of lemon over the salmon.

None.nutritionistTip: Hydration is key! Aim to drink at least 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day to stay hydrated.

breakfast.name: Scrambled Eggs on Toast
breakfast.description: Two scrambled eggs served on a slice of whole-wheat toast with avocado.
preparation: Toast the bread and top with sliced avocado.
Whisk eggs with milk and scramble in a non-stick pan.
Serve eggs on top of the avocado toast.

midMorningSnack.name: Handful of Almonds
midMorningSnack.description: A small handful of raw, unsalted almonds.
preparation: Enjoy a handful of almonds as a quick snack.

lunch.name: Turkey and Avocado Wrap
lunch.description: Sliced turkey breast with avocado, lettuce, and tomato in a whole-wheat tortilla.
preparation: Lay out the tortilla.
Layer the turkey, avocado, lettuce, and tomato.
Roll it up tightly.

afternoonSnack.name: Pear
afternoonSnack.description: A fresh, juicy pear.
preparation: Wash and eat.

dinner.name: Beef Stir-fry
dinner.description: Lean beef strips stir-fried with broccoli, bell peppers, and snap peas in a light soy-ginger sauce, served with rice.
preparation: Heat oil in a wok or large pan.
Stir-fry beef until browned.
Add vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Add soy sauce and ginger, and toss to combine. Serve over rice.

None.nutritionistTip: Incorporate a variety of colorful vegetables into your meals to ensure a wide range of vitamins and minerals.

breakfast.name: Fruit Smoothie
breakfast.description: A smoothie made with mixed berries, spinach, protein powder, and almond milk.
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

midMorningSnack.name: Cottage Cheese
midMorningSnack.description: A cup of cottage cheese with peach slices.
preparation: Simply combine cottage cheese and peaches in a bowl.

lunch.name: Leftover Beef Stir-fry
lunch.description: Enjoy the delicious leftovers from last night's dinner.
preparation: Reheat in a microwave or on the stovetop until warm.

afternoonSnack.name: Rice Cakes with Hummus
afternoonSnack.description: Two brown rice cakes topped with a generous spread of hummus.
preparation: Spread hummus on rice cakes.

dinner.name: Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies
dinner.description: Chicken thighs roasted on a sheet pan with potatoes, carrots, and onions.
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Toss chicken and veggies with olive oil and herbs.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes, or until chicken is cooked and veggies are tender.

None.nutritionistTip: Meal prepping, like making extra for dinner to have for lunch the next day, can save you time and help you stick to your nutrition plan.

breakfast.name: Oatmeal with Berries
breakfast.description: A warm bowl of rolled oats topped with mixed berries and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
preparation: Cook oats as directed, then top with berries and chia seeds.

midMorningSnack.name: Greek Yogurt
midMorningSnack.description: A serving of plain Greek yogurt with a drizzle of honey.
preparation: Serve yogurt in a bowl, optionally with honey.

lunch.name: Lentil Soup
lunch.description: A hearty bowl of homemade lentil soup with a side of whole-grain bread.
preparation: Heat up the lentil soup.
Serve with a slice of bread for dipping.

afternoonSnack.name: Orange
afternoonSnack.description: A fresh and juicy orange.
preparation: Peel and enjoy.

dinner.name: Fish Tacos
dinner.description: Two corn tortillas filled with grilled white fish, cabbage slaw, and a lime crema.
preparation: Grill or pan-sear the fish until flaky.
Warm the tortillas.
Assemble the tacos with fish, slaw, and a drizzle of lime crema.

None.nutritionistTip: Listening to your body's hunger and fullness cues is just as important as what you eat. Eat when you're hungry and stop when you're satisfied.

breakfast.name: Avocado Toast with Egg
breakfast.description: One slice of whole-wheat toast topped with mashed avocado and a fried egg.
preparation: Toast the bread.
Mash the avocado and spread it on the toast.
Fry an egg to your liking and place it on top.

midMorningSnack.name: Apple with Peanut Butter
midMorningSnack.description: A crisp apple with two tablespoons of natural peanut butter.
preparation: Slice the apple and serve with peanut butter.

lunch.name: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas
lunch.description: A refreshing salad of quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, and a lemon-tahini dressing.
preparation: Combine quinoa, chickpeas, and vegetables in a bowl.
Drizzle with dressing and toss to combine.

afternoonSnack.name: Small Protein Bar
afternoonSnack.description: A store-bought or homemade protein bar.
preparation: Unwrap and eat.

dinner.name: Homemade Pizza
dinner.description: A personal-sized pizza on a whole-wheat crust with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and your favorite veggies.
preparation: Preheat oven according to crust directions.
Top crust with sauce, cheese, and veggies.
Bake until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

None.nutritionistTip: Healthy eating doesn't mean you can't enjoy your favorite foods. Making healthier versions at home, like this pizza, can be both nutritious and satisfying.

breakfast.name: Pancakes with Berries
breakfast.description: Two whole-wheat pancakes topped with fresh berries and a small amount of maple syrup.
preparation: Prepare pancakes from a mix or from scratch.
Serve topped with berries and maple syrup.

midMorningSnack.name: Trail Mix
midMorningSnack.description: A small handful of a mix of nuts, seeds, and dried fruit.
preparation: A simple and easy snack for on the go.

lunch.name: Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup
lunch.description: A classic comfort meal: grilled cheese on whole-wheat bread with a bowl of tomato soup.
preparation: Make a grilled cheese sandwich.
Heat up the tomato soup and serve alongside the sandwich.

afternoonSnack.name: Celery with Cream Cheese
afternoonSnack.description: Celery sticks filled with light cream cheese.
preparation: Wash and cut celery stalks.
Fill with cream cheese.

dinner.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
dinner.description: A lighter version of the classic pasta dish, using turkey bacon and a moderate amount of cheese.
preparation: Cook spaghetti.
While it cooks, crisp the turkey bacon.
Whisk egg yolk with Parmesan and pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving some water. Quickly toss with the egg mixture, bacon, and a splash of pasta water to create a creamy sauce.

None.nutritionistTip: Enjoy your weekend! It's okay to incorporate comfort foods. The key is moderation and balance over the course of the week.

breakfast.name: Breakfast Burrito
breakfast.description: A whole-wheat tortilla filled with scrambled eggs, black beans, salsa, and a little cheese.
preparation: Warm the tortilla.
Fill with scrambled eggs, black beans, salsa, and cheese.
Fold into a burrito.

midMorningSnack.name: Banana
midMorningSnack.description: A simple and effective energy-boosting banana.
preparation: Peel and eat.

lunch.name: Leftover Spaghetti
lunch.description: Enjoy the delicious leftovers from Saturday's dinner.
preparation: Reheat gently on the stove or in the microwave.

afternoonSnack.name: Hard-Boiled Egg
afternoonSnack.description: One hard-boiled egg, a great source of protein.
preparation: Peel and eat a pre-boiled egg.

dinner.name: Roast Chicken with Root Vegetables
dinner.description: A classic Sunday dinner. A portion of roast chicken with roasted carrots, parsnips, and potatoes.
preparation: Enjoy a well-balanced, hearty meal to end the week.

None.nutritionistTip: Use Sunday to plan your meals for the upcoming week. A little preparation can go a long way in helping you stay on track with your nutrition goals.

breakfast.name: Protein Oatmeal
breakfast.description: Oats cooked with a scoop of protein powder, topped with banana slices.
ingredients: 1 scoop vanilla or chocolate protein powder
preparation: Cook oats with liquid as usual.
Once cooked, stir in the protein powder until fully combined.
Top with banana slices and serve immediately.

midMorningSnack.name: Hard-Boiled Eggs
midMorningSnack.description: Two hard-boiled eggs for a protein-packed snack.
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water.
Bring to a boil, then cover and remove from heat.
Let stand for 10-12 minutes.
Drain and cool in ice water before peeling.

lunch.name: Chicken Breast & Sweet Potato
lunch.description: Grilled chicken breast with a baked sweet potato and a side of broccoli.
preparation: Bake the sweet potato at 200°C (400°F) for 45-50 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear the chicken breast until cooked through.
Steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
Serve all components together.

afternoonSnack.name: Cottage Cheese
afternoonSnack.description: A cup of low-fat cottage cheese with pineapple chunks.
preparation: Combine cottage cheese and pineapple in a bowl.

dinner.name: Lean Beef with Brown Rice
dinner.description: Lean ground beef with brown rice and mixed vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., peas, carrots, corn)
preparation: Cook ground beef in a skillet until browned, drain any excess fat.
Stir in the mixed vegetables and cook until heated through.
Serve the beef and vegetable mixture over the brown rice.

None.nutritionistTip: Protein timing is crucial for sprinters. Consume a protein-rich snack or meal within an hour after your training session to maximize muscle repair.

breakfast.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
breakfast.description: Layers of Greek yogurt, berries, and a sprinkle of granola.
preparation: Layer yogurt, berries, and granola in a glass or bowl.

midMorningSnack.description: A high-protein, low-carb snack perfect for recovery.

preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Toss asparagus in olive oil.
Place cod and asparagus on a baking sheet, top cod with lemon slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes.

None.nutritionistTip: On rest days, slightly lower your carbohydrate intake and focus on high-quality protein to aid muscle recovery and growth.

dinner.name: Tofu, Rice, and Veggies
dinner.description: A large portion of baked tofu with a hefty side of white rice and steamed green beans.
preparation: Bake tofu at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Steam the green beans until tender.
Serve the tofu with the rice and green beans.
